Ruler of Kuwait, Sir, I n o directed by His yCxoellenoy the Political Resident in the Persian Culf to inform His Highness the Sultan of Muscat and Omun that Shaikh Abdulla bin Salim al SubahjC* I. 3., was formally recognised by His Majesty's Government on the 21st February 19b0, as Ruler of iluwait in succession to the late Sir Ahmad bin Jabir. isWll be grateful if you will kindly arrange to inform His Highness the Sultan at the earliest opportunity. I have the honour to be Sir, Your obedient servant, Sd/- F. C.L. Chauncy. His Majesty's Consul, Muscat. Minister for Foreign Affairs. MUSCAT. Copy to His Excellency the Political Resident. BAHRAIN. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the rear to the front.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 6, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: Correspondence between the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf, Bahrain, and the Political Agency, Muscat. The correspondence includes: a list of the rulers of Persian Gulf states with details of their titles and salutes; notification that Shaikh Abdulla bin Salim al Subah [‘Abdullāh bin Sālim Āl Ṣabāḥ] has been recognised as the new ruler of Kuwait, in succession to his late cousin.
